src:
Feijóo pide acabar este domingo con la "pesadilla" de Sánchez
Avisa de que el país "se ha parado" // Insiste en que "el único partido" que puede conseguir "escaños alternativos" a un gobierno de Sánchez es el Partido Popular
07 Nov 2019, 12:05 by SANTIAGO. EP   
El líder de los populares gallegos, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, ha pedido el voto a los gallegos para acabar este domingo con la "pesadilla" que supone el socialista Pedro Sánchez al frente del Gobierno y ha avisado de que el país "se ha parado".
"Este país se ha parado y, cuando un país se para, o reaccionamos o nos vamos al paro", ha advertido el también presidente de la Xunta en un acto del PP ofrecido en Santiago de Compostela y al que han asistido apoderados e interventores.
Feijóo ha hecho hincapié en que España "no aguanta más" con Sánchez al frente del Gobierno del Estado y ha pedido "no esperar a que el deterioro económico sea mayor". Así, se ha referido a problemas como los de las plantas de Aloca, los de los trabajadores de Fenosa en Meirama, los de los "camioneros que llevan la madera" de Ence para reivindicar que "Galicia merece un respeto".
"Las familias defienden su trabajo y nosotros defendemos a las familias", ha subrayado Feijóo, que ha pedido el voto al PP para que "haya un gobierno que gobierne" y para el que "su principal problema sean las familias españolas". "Que sepa distinguir entre politiquear y gestionar", ha señalado tras referirse a los dos últimos años como los de la "campaña más larga de la democracia".
"VESTUARIO DEL PP"En el acto al que han asistido apoderados e interventores y al que Feijóo se ha referido como una "reunión en el vestuario del PP antes de la gran contienda democrática", el jefe de filas de los populares gallegos ha arengado a los suyos para "esto empiece a cambiar" el próximo domingo en cuanto "cierren la urnas".
A los presentes les ha pedido que "ni la estrategia del PSOE ni la campaña" les haga "olvidar" el motivo de la repetición electoral que, según ha indicado, es que "Pedro Sánchez sustituyó a un gobierno que creaba empleo y que aprobaba presupuestos" por otro que se apoya en "todos aquellos que llevan lazos amarillos".
"Estamos aquí porque (Sánchez) no quiso formar gobierno porque pensó que los españoles lo iban a premiar la cuarta vez que bloqueaba a España", ha expresado Feijóo, que ha considerado que "España necesita que Pedro Sánchez pierda para que la mayoría de los españoles ganen".
Asimismo, ha instado a los presentes a "no olvidar" el domingo la "inestabilidad" de los dos últimos años ni "el continuado menosprecio a Galicia y a los gallegos" por parte del Partido Socialista y de su candidato.
UNIDAD DEL VOTO"No olvidemos que si volvemos a votar divididos se repetirá el resultado", ha avisado Feijóo. "Si votamos unidos esto cambiará", ha señalado para abogar por "una nueva etapa en España".
"Podemos y tenemos que lograr más diputados y senadores que Pedro Sánchez", ha asegurado el líder de los populares gallegos, que ha considerado que, para alcanzar este objetivo, los gallegos no pueden "picar el anzuelo" del PSOE. "Que no funcione su estrategia de darle protagonismo a otros partidos políticos a los que incluso lleva a la televisión pública para que cojan espacio", ha censurado.
Tras ello, ha dejado claro que "el único partido" que puede conseguir "escaños alternativos a un gobierno de Sánchez es el PP". "Si somos capaces de captar a la mayoría de los españoles que no quieren que vuelva a gobernar Sánchez con sus socios, entonces, gobernaremos", ha apuntado.
"Más que nunca, el PP es lo que es, lo que ha sido siempre y lo que seguirá siendo en el futuro. Por eso en el próximo domingo solo hay dos opciones, o Pedro Sánchez o el cambio político que representa el Partido Popular".
SÁNCHEZ, EL "RESPONSABLE" DE LA REPETICIÓNEn el acto, además, ha intervenido el presidente de los populares compostelanos, Borja Verea; el responsable provincial del PP, Diego Calgo; así como la 'número uno' del Partido Popular al Congreso por A Coruña, Marta González.
En su intervención, Marta González ha criticado que Sánchez "desde el primer día" decidiese ir a unas "nuevas elecciones". "Es el responsable", ha asegurado la candidata al Congreso, que ha instado al socialista a "que deje paso a otros". "Es lo que necesitamos para trabajar por Galicia y España", ha apuntado.
Además, se ha referido a Vox como aquellos que dan "más golpes encima de la mesa" y "gritan más". "Esos de los que estamos hablando, no tienen ninguna experiencia de gobierno, no saben qué hacer, da la impresión que ni se han leído la Constitución española", ha asegurado para advertir a "a todos aquellos que estén pensando en votar a esa gente" para que "no lo hagan". "Porque sería como echar el voto en la papelera o votar a Pedro Sánchez", ha argumentado.
"METE LA PATA"Por su parte, el presidente del PP de A Coruña, Diego Calvo, ha destacado que en los últimos días de campaña se está viendo a Sánchez "meter la pata" en referencia a sus declaraciones sobre la Fiscalía. Además, ha asegurado que incluso en los últimos días todos los organismos internacionales "están desmintiendo" lo que dicen los socialistas.
"Si unimos nuestro voto, ganamos las elecciones", ha señalado el dirigente popular, que ha criticado que el resto de formaciones solo busquen "intentar que se divida el voto del PP". "El trabajo de toda esta gente es que el próximo domingo unamos el voto", ha señalado.
El acto ha sido arrancado por el nuevo líder del PP de Santiago, Borja Verea, quien ha hecho un reconocimiento a todos aquellos interventores y apoderados que llevan varias décadas trabajando por el partido en la ciudad.
text:
Feijóo asks to end this Sunday with Sánchez's "nightmare"
Warns that the country "has stopped" // Insists that "the only party" that can get "alternative seats" to a government of Sanchez is the Popular Party
07 Nov 2019, 12:05 by SANTIAGO. EP
The leader of the popular Galicians, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, has asked for the vote of the Galicians to end this Sunday with the "nightmare" that the socialist Pedro Sánchez represents at the head of the Government and has warned that the country "has stopped".
"This country has stopped and, when a country stops, or we react or go to unemployment," the president of the Xunta also warned in an act of the PP offered in Santiago de Compostela and attended by attorneys and interveners.
Feijóo has stressed that Spain "can not stand" with Sánchez at the head of the State Government and has asked "not to wait until the economic deterioration is greater." Thus, he has referred to problems such as those of Aloca plants, those of Fenosa's workers in Meirama, those of Ence's "truck drivers who carry the wood" to claim that "Galicia deserves respect."
"Families defend their work and we defend families," said Feijóo, who has asked the PP to vote so that "there is a government that governs" and for which "their main problem is the Spanish families." "That he knows how to distinguish between politicizing and managing," he said after referring to the last two years as those of the "longest campaign of democracy."
"VESTUARIO DEL PP" In the act attended by proxies and interveners and which Feijóo has referred to as a "meeting in the locker room of the PP before the great democratic contest," the leader of the popular Galician ranks has harangued yours for "this begins to change" next Sunday as soon as "close the polls."
He has asked those present that "neither the strategy of the PSOE nor the campaign" makes them "forget" the reason for the electoral repetition that, as indicated, is that "Pedro Sánchez replaced a government that created employment and approved budgets "on the other that is based on" all those who wear yellow ties. "
"We are here because (Sánchez) did not want to form a government because he thought the Spaniards were going to reward him the fourth time he blocked Spain," said Feijóo, who has considered that "Spain needs Pedro Sánchez to lose so that most of the Spaniards win. "
He also urged those present to "not forget" on Sunday the "instability" of the last two years or "the continued disregard of Galicia and the Galicians" by the Socialist Party and its candidate.
VOTE UNIT "Let's not forget that if we vote again, the result will be repeated," Feijóo said. "If we vote together this will change," he said to advocate for "a new stage in Spain."
"We can and we have to achieve more deputies and senators than Pedro Sánchez," said the leader of the popular Galicians, who has considered that, to achieve this goal, Galicians cannot "chop the hook" of the PSOE. "That his strategy of giving prominence to other political parties to which he even takes public television to take space" does not work, "he has censored.
After that, he has made it clear that "the only party" that can get "alternative seats to a Sánchez government is the PP". "If we are able to capture the majority of Spaniards who do not want Sanchez to re-govern with their partners, then we will govern," he said.
"More than ever, the PP is what it is, what it has always been and what will continue to be in the future. That is why there are only two options next Sunday, or Pedro Sánchez or the political change represented by the Popular Party" .
SÁNCHEZ, THE "RESPONSIBLE" OF THE REPETITIONIn the act, in addition, the president of the popular compostelanos, Borja Verea; the provincial head of the PP, Diego Calgo; as well as the 'number one' of the Popular Party to Congress by A Coruña, Marta González.
In his speech, Marta González has criticized that Sánchez "from day one" decided to go to "new elections." "He is responsible," said the candidate for Congress, who urged the socialist to "give way to others." "It is what we need to work for Galicia and Spain," he said.
In addition, he has referred to Vox as those who give "more knocks on the table" and "shout more." "Those we are talking about, they have no experience of government, they do not know what to do, it seems that they have not even read the Spanish Constitution," he said to warn "all those who are thinking of voting those people "so that" they do not do it ". "Because it would be like throwing the vote in the bin or voting for Pedro Sánchez," he argued.
"METE LA PATA" For his part, the president of the PP of A Coruña, Diego Calvo, stressed that in the last days of the campaign Sanchez is being seen "getting his leg" in reference to his statements on the Prosecutor's Office. In addition, he has ensured that even in recent days all international organizations "are denying" what the Socialists say.
"If we join our vote, we win the elections," said the popular leader, who has criticized that the other formations only seek to "try to divide the vote of the PP." "The job of all these people is that next Sunday we join the vote," he said.
The act has been started by the new leader of the PP of Santiago, Borja Verea, who has made a recognition to all those interveners and proxies who have been working for the party in the city for several decades.
